title: Mathematical Information Literacy Workshop for Collaborative Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (fractions, ratios, statistics, etc.) and basic smartphone/tablet operation skills
context.additional_context: Learners internalize a relational approach by collecting, analyzing, and utilizing mathematical information to solve everyday problems. Public datasets are used to set community issues (e.g., budget allocation, population statistics analysis) as project themes.

learning_goals: Learners document the process of solving mathematical problems using real public data and improve their outcomes by at least 80% by incorporating peer feedback.
Learners select and comparatively analyze reliable data from three or more sources (National Statistical Office, local government reports, academic papers).
Through team projects, learners derive mathematical conclusions and present them as visual materials (e.g., infographics) understandable to non-experts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
